name: Sunwapta Falls Rocky Mountain Lodge

reviews.text: We stayed here on a reservation and were very pleased. It was clean, a well maintained area and you could walk right down to the falls in 10 minutes from the lodge. The food was good at the restaurant and you really had not choice to eat there but it was good...although a bit pricey - maybe because of it being the only place around. Nice standard cabin rooms and it was clean.
reviews.title: A lot nicer and cleaner than it looked from the road!

reviews.text: We stayed here on our trip across Canada and have to say while it was a decent pkace to stay it really is not worth the price. The hotel is about 30 minutes from Jasper and is all by it's lonesome. If you want a quiet get away then sure this is the right atmosphere. Overall the hotel is very dated and in need of a make over.
reviews.title: A bit deceiving...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though I gave this place an average rating, because it was average, my husband and I really enjoyed our stay. The place has a kind of nostalgic summer camp feel about it. Our main complaint is the price. It is about twice as much as what you would expect it to be. The room was very comfortable, clean and even though it was on the road it was pretty quiet. The staff was lovely as well. The food in the restaurant was also pretty good and again, very expensive. We had a great sleep, in a convenient location and we paid way too much money for it. Oh well. Next time we'll probably reserve at a campsite.
reviews.title: Cool Icefields Parkway stay

reviews.text: It was Sunday evening of Canada Day weekend and the 3 of us realized we really were leaving it late to be getting away from Jasper to make our way back to north of Edmonton. ! of us wasn't feeling well, and, so really wanted to stay one more night in the area. Sunwapta found us a 2 bedroom cabin that, although wasn't anything special, it was very quaint and clean. Our only complaints was that there was no hairdryer and no complimentary wifi. Other than that, we were comfortable and appreciative of a last minute accommodation on a busy weekend ! We didn't walk the trail to the Falls as 1 of us was not well, but, it looked very inviting. We had breakfast there and was very impressed with the service as well as the food, both in taste and quantity. It was not a honeymoon suite, but, a very nice place to hang your hat for a night !
reviews.title: Corry T

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were very happy with Sunwapta Resort! I had won a contest to stay for 2 nights and we added on 3 nights of our own... we had a blast. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Only the two nights were suppose to include meals (from the contest) but they added them on free for the entire trip for us and the food was excellent! That was extremely generous of Sunwapta! The staff gave us tips on what to see and do while visiting and patiently answered any questions we had. Some definite adventures to go on if your able when visiting Jasper would be the Motorcycle sidecar tour and white water rafting! We were warned that the internet was pretty much nil out there but that wasn't a problem for us, we wanted more of a technology free rest. We even used the fireplace the first night we arrived as it was a bit rainy. We had a cabin room with a king size be which we both found comfortable. All in all I would go back any day and would recommend Sunwapta to all my friends.
reviews.title: Excellent Trip!

reviews.text: Very clean, older property on the Icefields Parkway about 30 minutes south of Jasper. Staff actually lives on the property and they all were a pleasure to deal with and very helpful. Our cabin was a bit outdated, but perfectly adequate for our needs, and very clean. We enjoyed dinner and breakfast at the restaurant, and it is as good as other reviewers have said. My husband loved the elk pot pie! Be sure to note that there is no cell phone service here (although there is a landline in the office), and the wifi is generally usable only from the lobby. It was wonderful to be in such a quiet, out of the way place after our busy stay in Banff, and we highly recommend this property.
reviews.title: A gem in the middle of nowhere

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sunwapta Falls Lodge first part of July, everthing was perfect, the lodge is on the older side, well its old but clean and comfortable, staff were very friendly and helpful, check-in and out was a breeze. The resturant is first class with food and service that goes far beyond
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: the normal. We had breakfast and dinner twice and it was flawless everytime. I would go back in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Awesome location, excellent service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent friendly place with exceptional view. Room was clean, had a nice view of the forest on one side, mountains on the other. Exceptional staff, very professional and personal. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Quiet and Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two days on our Rocky Mountain Driving Excursion and were quite happy with it overall. The front desk staff escorted us to our room gave us a quick tour and let us know what activities were available in the immediate area. They also recommended some light hiking and driving trails that proved spot on!
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked in here for two nights and were very impressed on arrival by the helpfulness of the staff. We were immediately given maps and shown places of interest to they recommended. We were told the route to walk to see Sunwapta falls which wasn't far from the lodge. Would definately recommend mosquito spray as they are huge. The rooms were basic and quite cramped. We had two double beds, would have been better to just ave one to give more space. We tried the food in their restaurant the first night as it is a 45 minute drive into Jasper. It was supposed to be fine dining, but the food was very basic and very overpriced. I think the fact that they are the only restaurant for miles influences the high prices. The staff were excellent when we got stuck due to the mud slides, they booked us an extra night and didn't take advantage of the situation by charging higher prices. Overall the accomodation was a great price and we were only in our room to sleep, so couldn't really expect anymore. The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff are what make the difference at Sunwapta falls lodge.
reviews.title: Reasonable priced, no frills accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this lodge based on the Trip Advisor reviews. Apparently my standards are higher than other reviewers. At almost $200 per night, I expected a level of luxury that this place didn't begin to have. We had spent the previous two night in 2 star motels, so I was really looking forward to two nights in better accommodations. I was disappointed. The location was lovely, away from the traffic and activity of Jasper. The people were very friendly and accommodating. Beyond that, there was nothing special about the resort. The bed in our room was uncomfortable. The towels were scratchy. The screens on the windows didn't fit correctly and let Mosquitos in. The curtain on the door was 3" shorter than the window allowing anyone to see in from the outside. They claim to have satellite Internet in all the rooms, but mostly it did not work. The on site restaurant was terribly expensive. This cannot possibly be toward the top of what Jasper has to offer.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night at Sunwapta Falls, they gave us a cabin, it was clean, comfortable and quiet, lovely fireplace, the restaurant served us a excellent supper (elk pot pie) and a hot breakfast. I would definitely recommend Sunwapta Falls to my friends.
reviews.title: Idealic setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated approx.half way between the Icefield Centre and Jasper and surrounded by mountains -this resort is very peaceful with helpful and friendly staff.
reviews.title: In the middle of nowhere surrounded by mountains

reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights which was probably a night too long as there is nothing in walking distance except for the Sunwapta Falls.
reviews.title: Great location, service and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stumbled upon the Sunwapta Falls Mountain Lodge by accident. We were looking for an alternative place to stay after the disastrous flooding that hit Alberta on June 26, 2013. We decided to originally stay for 2 nights, but then extended our stay for a total of 4 nights after we discovered the beauty of the area! The Sunwapta Lodge is conveniently located to Icefields Center (only a 30 minute drive) and 40 minutes from downtown Jasper. There are so many things to do around the Lodge that will immerse you in nature! If you are looking for gorgeous hiking routes, beautiful scenery, and plentiful wildlife, then Sunwapta is a great place for you!
reviews.title: Hidden Jem on the Icefields Parkway!

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Fantastic cabin in Jasper

reviews.text: 1) Phenomenally Accommodating Staff: Ask for Janessa at the front desk. She gives great advice about the area and things to do! She goes out of her way to be attentive to you!
reviews.title: Why stay in Jasper!

reviews.text: 2) Wonderful Restaurant: The food is priced reasonablly for breakfast and dinner. The chef cooks fantastic meals with good sized portions.
reviews.title: CHARMING MOUNTAIN HIDEOUT!

reviews.text: 3) Excellent wait staff: In our experience, Annette, Lauren, and Haley provided wonderful service at all meals.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

aka: Sunwapta Falls Rocky Mountain Hotel Jasper
description: A recent recipient of TripAdvisor's Certificate of Excellence, Sunwapta Falls Rocky Mountain Lodge is an ideal choice if you're looking to unplug from the hectic pace of regular life. Most often chosen for our location, the lodge is a scenic 45-minute drive south of downtown Jasper. We're open from mid-May to early-October.Our location provides a less distracted experience of our natural surroundings. Located just off the Icefields Parkway, our cabin-style accommodation is nestled in the forest between mountains and lakes with just a short walk to the beautiful Sunwapta Falls and many major attractions nearby. In the evenings its just us, the stars, the sound of the falls and the scent of wood burning as it crackles in our many fireplaces. There's no cell phone reception and there are no phones in the rooms. Despite our rustic setting, our accommodations are immaculately kept with award wining housekeeping practices, and our evening dining is not to be missed. Satellite internet is provided via WiFi at no charge and satellite TV is also provided at no charge. With only 50 rooms, the service at Sunwapta is exceptionally high. Our front desk commits time to each guest, providing complementary expert advice and daily customized sightseeing agendas to help you experience those WOW moments. We also act as ticketing agents for all the major and minor attractions. During your stay with us, we will take care of all your activity bookings and daily planning. Each and every one of our staff is entirely committed to helping you have a truly memorable experience in Jasper National Park. Prepare to be 'treated like royalty'!A 2 star property, Sunwapta offers a mix of cabin-style accommodations with real wood-burning stone fireplaces (includes complementary wood and service), and contemporary hotel style rooms. Our accommodations are suitable for romantic getaways and family vacations. We look forward to helping you experience the best of Jasper... wonderful by nature.
